page.title: 02NORTH HYKEHAM
page.content: The area is generally used for residential,farming and extractive industrial purposes. There are eight schools in the area which means there are alot of children,although the number of school age children has dropped over the last few years. Housing covers half the area surveyed. There is a lot of inland water which attracts fishermen and sailing clubs. There are five gravel pits in the area,some within two square kilometres of each other. The town has grown rapidly over the last 25 years,during which time most of the housing,shops and schools have been built,changing a small village into a large town.
